section.title: The Hypervisor Boot Menu

step.para: Insert the Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Hypervisor installation media.
Power on the system and ensure the system boots from the installation media.
The boot splash screen appears. If no input is provided, the hypervisor installation will commence in 30 seconds, using default kernel parameters.

textobject.phrase: The boot splash screen counts down for 30 seconds before automatically booting the system.

step.para: To modify the boot options, press any key. The boot menu will display.

textobject.phrase: The boot menu screen displays all pre-defined boot options, as well as providing the option to edit them.

step.para: The following boot options are available:

listitem.para: Install or Upgrade the Hypervisor, using basic video mode.

term.guilabel: Install or Upgrade with Serial Console

listitem.para: Install or Upgrade the Hypervisor, with the console redirected to a serial device attached to /dev/ttyS0.
Reinstall the hypervisor, using basic video mode.
Reinstall the Hypervisor, with the console redirected to a serial device attached to /dev/ttyS0.
Boot the operating system installed on the first local drive.

step.para: Select the appropriate boot option from the boot menu.
Press the Enter key to boot the Hypervisor with the default kernel parameters for the option selected; or

press the Tab key to edit the kernel parameters. In edit mode you are able to add or remove kernel parameters. Kernel parameters must be separated from each other by a space. Once the desired kernel parameters have been set press Enter to boot the system. Alternatively pressing Esc reverts any changes that you have made to the kernel parameters.

textobject.phrase: The boot parameters screen allows you to add and remove boot parameters.

step.para: For a list of supported kernel parameters, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux â€” Hypervisor Deployment Guide.

section.para: The hypervisor boots with the provided boot options.
